episode_summary: This episode features facts about the inventor of the lie detector marrying his first test subject, the high number of companies registered in Liechtenstein, a historical claim of a giant robot Cleopatra, and manatees controlling their buoyancy through flatulence.

facts.fact: The person who invented the lie detector married the first person he interrogated with it.
Liechtenstein has roughly two companies for every person who lives there.
In 47 BC, there was a giant robot Cleopatra walking the streets of Alexandria, squirting milk from her breasts onto the heads of onlookers.
Manatees control their buoyancy through flatulence.
